data.title: Careers
data.text:
It takes extraordinarily talented people to bring you the programs you enjoy on WYPR. With the growth at WYPR we will occasionally need experienced self motivated people to work in several departments. Regretfully, we cannot accept telephone applications. Thanks for your interest in WYPR.

Annual EEO Public Report

The Organization

WYPR is a long-standing, reliable source of news, captivating programming and community engagement in the greater Baltimore and Maryland region.

The mission of Your Public Radio Corporation is to inform, connect and even challenge the listeners we serve in the metropolitan Baltimore area and the State of Maryland by broadcasting programs of intellectual integrity and cultural merit so as to provide an unbiased perspective of the events of today and to enrich the minds and spirits of our audience.

When jobs are posted, submit cover letter (cite recruitment source) and resume using link on the posting or to Business Manager-WYPR, 2216 N. Charles St., Baltimore, MD 21218 . No phone calls, please. WYPR is an EOE.

Mid-Afternoon Host/Producer FM

WYPR 88.1 FM, Baltimore’s NPR radio station, is looking for a Mid-Afternoon Host/Producer FM. This essential role requires an experienced broadcaster, audio editor and producer capable of working multiple shifts, including weekends and able to fill several roles, from live/fill-in hosting to voice tracking, to audio production. Some duties will be expected on a weekly basis, other duties will be assigned. The individual should be nimble, flexible, eager and enthusiastic about broadcasting, public media, live hosting and creating meaningful audio.

Learn more and apply with cover letter and resume. Alternative mailing address: Business Manager, 2216 N. Charles St., Baltimore., MD. 21218. WYPR is an Equal Opportunity Employer. No phone calls, please.

Mid-Level Gifts Manager

The Mid-Level Gifts Manager will support Baltimore Public Media’s efforts to reach ambitious, transformative goals to sustain the growth of both WTMD 89.7 FM and WYPR 88.1 FM and broaden public radio programming in Maryland. This role will work closely with the Director of Major Giving & Philanthropy and the broader Marketing, Membership + Engagement team to identify, cultivate, steward, and solicit donors and prospects at the mid-level giving of $750-$2,499 to fund the operations of the station, capital expenditures, special projects and programming. The ideal individual is a detail-oriented self-starter with strong interpersonal skills and a passion for public radio. A background in Membership and Major Giving is essential as well as knowledge of the overall giving community within Maryland.

Learn more and apply here with cover letter and resume. Alternative mailing address: Business Manager, 2216 N. Charles St., Baltimore., MD. 21218. WYPR is an Equal Opportunity Employer. No phone calls, please.

Frederick County Freelance Reporter

WYPF & WYPR are seeking a Frederick County based freelance reporter who can give voice to those Marylanders in the sixth congressional district including Garrett, Allegany, Frederick, and Washington counties as well as a portion of Montgomery County. They will have the curiosity and skills to produce a wide swath of stories with accuracy and a compelling narrative. This position will report to the news director and in their absence, the executive director of news. You will bring a toolkit that shows demonstrated acumen in field production, breaking news coverage, community news and feature stories. While this position is remote, you will be fully immersed in newsroom training and take part in team building exercises and meetings when applicable.

We don’t think that geography should hamper us from better serving all of those in our listening area and thus highlighting the mosaic that is Maryland’s culture and politics. The voices of Frederick County are an integral part of the varied opinions and issues that come from the growing northern part of our state. Most importantly, WYPR has a tower and a clear signal there, and we’d like to better serve them. Frederick County also has a vocal Latin American and a native Nigerian community. Just another example of Maryland’s overall diversity.

Learn more and apply here with cover letter and resume. Alternative mailing address: Business Manager, 2216 N. Charles St., Baltimore., MD. 21218. WYPR is an Equal Opportunity Employer. No phone calls, please.

Morning Edition News Host

WYPR 88.1 FM is Baltimore’s NPR radio station is looking for a Morning Edition News Host who will guide listeners through daily news programming in ways that are listener-focused, engaging, personable, and timely. They will be good company, an engaging guide, and let listeners know what’s happening each day in Baltimore and the world. The host delivers the highest public radio standards for presenting news, weather, traffic and produced content to a live audience. The host will also create periodic content for broadcast and digital (e.g., fundraising, web, production and participating in live on-air fundraising), and fill in on other shifts as needed.

Learn more and apply here with cover letter and resume. Alternative mailing address: Business Manager, 2216 N. Charles St., Baltimore., MD. 21218. WYPR is an Equal Opportunity Employer. No phone calls, please.

Radio Underwriting Sales Executive

Your Public Radio is the public radio service for Baltimore, Central Maryland, and the Eastern Shore. We are WYPR 88.1 FM (NPR News) and WTMD 89.7 FM (AAA music) and we are seeking a full-time sales professional to join the underwriting team. The Sales Account Executive will be a part of a collaborative and successful sales team. The ideal candidate is responsible for developing revenue by soliciting business, non-profit, and foundation support in the form of underwriting on radio, digital platforms, and event sponsorship. You will use your strong relationship selling skills and develop win-win solutions for our sponsors as they align their brands with the highly valued and trusted resource of public media in the Baltimore area. This goal focused candidate must be able to interpret industry qualitative & quantitative research. If you are super professional, passionate, resilient and a very creative thinker who can work together with the programming and membership departments of both stations and creatively develop and combine opportunities, please apply. Prior media sales experience is a major plus.

Learn more and apply here with cover letter and resume. Alternative mailing address: Business Manager, 2216 N. Charles St., Baltimore., MD. 21218. WYPR is an Equal Opportunity Employer. No phone calls, please.

WYPR is looking forward to welcoming interns in the near future. We will provide more information on upcoming opportunities soon.
